abstract: The emerging uncertainties about the foreclosure process are dangerous to banks, which should once again take stress tests to assess their stability, an economist writes.
snippet: The emerging uncertainties about the foreclosure process are dangerous to banks, which should once again take stress tests to assess their stability, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, the former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, is a co-author of “13 Bankers.”

headline.main: Time for Some New Stress Tests for Banks
